content: Quick fix: I removed the trailing spaces in testcase 5, validator 5, testcase 7, validator 7.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I already commented.  Nice upgrade from the earlier puzzle.

I think the "negative mountains" make a nice addition to the original puzzle.  That gets my upvote.  

PS: I didn't hit "Submit" while I went to play-test the puzzle.  I'm giving my first "Approve" vote to this, too.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It can be interesting. I learned something from it (regarding rendering ASCII). Like all ASCII puzzles i would put this into higher category, but the classic CG ASCII puzzle (which is harder imo) is also on easy.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and fun puzzle.
Great Job

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
I enjoy that idea! Really fun :)

Enjoyed the puzzle a lot, thank you for creating it. Also really appreciate humor in description. I'm several levels short of having right to approve, but if I reach lvl 20 before your puzzle is accepted, you can count on my vote.

The problem is quite nice. I enjoyed solving it, even if it may require some trial and error, not having a standard way of solving. Because of this I would suggest rising the difficulty level a step higher, as I consider 'easy' to be a level where you should be able to solve it just by applying a well-known algorithm. Now I may have overcomplicated myself and there might have been an easier way of solving it, of course.
The problem is beautiful nonetheless and I would love to see it approved.
Upvoted.  Rally the previous approvers then ping me to come approve it also

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: This might seem petty, but I'm just going to say it.  I don't like ASCII art puzzles.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very original puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment:

You could extend it further to track the total altitude climbed and descended, the maximum altitude climbed, and so on. I remember I got asked this in an interview for a fitness company - apparently they needed to solve it in O(N)  and it is trickier than it sounds.
I didn't get negatives examples. As for me for -1 it should be: \/

It's not clear to me how to determine the start point of the next mountain.
Example: two mountains with heights 2 3 could be
      /\
 /\  /  \
/  \/    \
or
    /\
 /\/  \
/      \
(you'll probably have to copy those to a monospace editor for that to look right)

Is there a "always start the next mountain as soon as possible" or similar rule that you could explicitly state in the description?

It is the second one. The /\ is necessary to find the mountain that's why I kept it like that.

And always start the next mountain as soon as possible. I am adding some rules in descriptions. Thanks for the heads up.

In negatives, you are going one step down and creating a mountain that represents the height of -1. So assume you need to make a mountain of -1, you would first reach one step below and then create it. Visual Example:

-           -
  \       /
    \/\/

The reason for doing this is to bring a variety of solutions in approaching this problem logically which changes the difficulty depending on how you approach it.  

I do understand the issue, and the improvement of having \/ for -1 would be, but when I weighed the benefits I preferred the current one. I will add some extra descriptions to help with the negatives.

( Also \/ wouldn't look as cool as the /\ for mountains ASCII, right?)

Hey, but isn't it a simple flood fill with priority over nonempty spaces from the starting point, where you consider a rise with '/ 'and fall with '\' and keep track of the total climbed and descended within a list which can be used for finding other associated values like maximum, minimum and other values.

Sounded like a fun idea, but I do think there can be more improvements on that concept.
This puzzle has been published again.  If you and alze approve again, I'd be happy to review and check if I'd approve.  Just reply to this comment when you do so I get a notification
This puzzle has been published again.  If you and selenae approve again, I'd be happy to review and check if I'd approve.  Just reply to this comment when you do so I get a notification

The hell is this? Are there other people which do love them? Will they benefit from having one more puzzle on CG? Then why preventing puzzle to appear?

Will adding ASCII puzzle somehow make things worse for ASCII haters? Will they still be able to just ignore it and solve other things? I understand reasons to remove low-quality contributions from site, but good puzzle in well established category, which you personally don't like...
would you consider approving the contribution if you liked it?
would you consider approving the contribution if you liked it and tested it out ?
I absolutely would if I could. Unfortunately I'm a couple of levels shy of the ability to do so.
Agh my bad, I thought you were able to. Thanks for letting me know.
